headline: Coronavirus Biden Signs Bill Declassify Covid 19 Origins Intel
summary: President Joe Biden signed abipartisan billMonday directing the government to declassify as much intelligence as possible about the origins of COVID-19.The Details:The legislation directs the Office of the Director of National Intelligence to declassify information about China’s Wuhan Institute of Virology, citing "potential links" betweencoronavirus research at the laband the outbreak of COVID-19. The bill moved through Congress with strong bipartisan support; the Housepassed it unanimously.Key Quote:"We need to get to the bottom of COVID-19's origins... including potential links to the Wuhan Institute of Virology," Biden said in a statement.For Context:The lab leak theory regained steam last month after the Energy Departmentshifted its stance to think a Wuhan lab leaklikely sparked the pandemic. The theory wasdismissed as a conspiracyby many journalists and Democrats early in the pandemic. Some agencies, including the Director of National Intelligence, still believe natural animal-to-human transmission was more likely. Other intelligence groups, including the CIA, are undecided. Over the weekend, a group of international researchers unveiled evidence that the pandemicoriginated from a pack of raccoon dogsin Wuhan. China rejects the lab theory, and hasobstructed investigationsinto COVID-19's origins.How the Media Covered It:Sources across the spectrum covered the signing prominently. Some right-rated sources focused more on how some media outlets prematurely discounted the lab leak theory.
